intro: Stauropsis truncata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette shape with compact growth. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple, and bloom throughout the growing season. Stauropsis truncata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
